intro: Cyathostemma wrayi var. indochinensis, commonly known as the Indochina cyathostemma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its attractive, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
